titleStmt.title: The scurrilous scribler dissected: or, A word in William Lilly's ear concerning his reputation, which he complains is injured by J.G. that ungrateful scorpionist, as he the said Lilly scurrilously terms him.
titleStmt.author: Gadbury, John, 1627-1704.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library, Oxford.
